channel.title: yay on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in yay on Barefoot Rob

item.title: got AB webserver upgraded
item.description: I got AB’s server upgraded from unsupported Ubuntu 12 to Ubuntu 18. Now running PHP 7 instead of unsupported 5.6 Now running RDS instead of MySQL on EC2. Not yet running ALB, but AWS tech team is looking into why the application was sometimes throwing 502 errors when I routed requests through ALB.

item.title: Remembering Past Lives workshop today
item.description: I am excited about Remembering Past Lives workshop today (written 17:13 Thursday 12 September 2019 JST:) Two people in attendance and had a good time! Great to hear their questions at the beginning. One was “What’s the process?” Each participant gets into a relaxed position, usually either sitting in a chair, or laying down, or otherwise sitting against something comfortable. I will spend a few minutes leading you through a relaxation process, whereby you let your body relax and keep your mind awake.

item.title: Gave dream catcher to Misato
item.description: 21:17 Wednesday 08 May 2019 JST I felt really happy to hear Misato with her eyes wide, say “a dreamcatcher!” Seems like it was a good choice.

item.title: today workin
item.description: 20:42 Wednesday 09 January 2019 JST Today was a long day, starting with recording a first draft of a video for my first GoFundMe campaign, then two TY lessons, two MKP meetings, lunch with Tomoko, then an hour chillin with “a flower in each hand” behind the desk of the Sweets Party Attendants, having a non-lesson with them because they have nothing going on. During this non-lesson, Tomoko showed me her “personal こたつ” which consisted of a heater under her desk and a blanket strategically arranged to drape down over her legs.

item.title: Thank you, Emacs
item.description: 20:28 Thursday 20 December 2018 JST Super nice: I was able to figure out how to create a function to simplify the creation of web pages for Marble Track 3 Parts](https://www.marbletrack3.com/parts/). Now I just type C-c p in Emacs, then enter the title, tags, and shortcode to produce a file for a new Part in the Marble Track 3 website. Today, with said shortcode, I started the page for Medium Catcher Below Triple Splitter.

item.title: met with Paul about The Men's Work
item.description: 19:53 Friday 05 October 2018 JST Exciting MKP Tokyo news! I sent this to my online Integration Group. I just got confirmation: I will be co-facilitating a 3-week online MKP introduction called The Men's Work https://mkpusa.org/themenswork/ with Paul Newell, who is currently co-facilitating it in the US. On Fridays, 7pm - 8:30pm (Japan time), November 3rd, 10th, and 17th, we will do this online training for men in Tokyo. Once we run this 3 week series of meetings a couple of times, I will create a new men's circle in Gotanda (Tokyo) on Fridays for men who are interested.

item.title: three quarters passed
item.description: 08:38 Tuesday 16 January 2018 JST I have passed three quarters of the tests.

item.title: arrived in Japan
item.description: 23:56 Monday 01 January 2018 JST We have arrived back in Haneda and are in a taxi back home. Didn’t realize trains would not be running very late so yay for 12000 yen for stale smoke flavored taxi. Last train was at 11:51 and would require two transfers, including from KQ Kawasaki to JR Kawasaki station. I get to work on MT3 tomorrow yayyy!

item.title: just finished the work I wanted to do this weekend
item.description: 19:44 Sunday 03 December 2017 JST Nate hasn’t set the Name servers for this domain the way he said he would, but I guess he understands the consequences.

item.title: met Kai and Mika for St Patrick's Day
item.description: 23:37 Saturday 17 March 2017 JST (written 13:37 Saturday 18 March 2017 JST) Last night I met Kai and Mika 久しぶり！We met near Mika’s work for dinner (I got lost on the way due to trusting Google maps which had been given incorrect input, and ended up taking a taxi (only 410 yen (wow!)) after realizing I had walked wayy off course) and then got ice cream whereupon they suggested I do something crazy.

item.title: Fantastic presentation last night!
item.description: 13:57 Friday 25 November 2016 JST Yay! Last night went better than I expected; pretty much near perfect as possible given my short prep time. These are some notes I wrote on the way home last night. Felt really nervous the days before Really dumb I hadn't practiced for nine months Leave me alone!! Stop changing it!!! Practice practice practice practice made it perfect Once we had the skeleton of the arc, filling in the muscles made it great During the Japanese presentations I practiced mine in my head.

item.title: great i-group
item.description: 11:02 Thursday 13 October 2016 AWST Great online I-group; got a lot of shit off my chest and feel lighter and more connected. Ready to go shopping for souvenirs and a few items for the weekend.

item.title: Close to getting tvos app finished
item.description: 21:37 Friday 15 January 2016 JST yay

item.title: Dreamhost will soon support Let's Encrypt!
item.description: 20:37 Thursday 31 December 2015 JST I’ve enjoyed using Dreamhost for years, and have always been impressed with how much I can do, and how great their service is for such a low price! Now that Let’s Encrypt has gone into public beta, Dreamhost will support free SSL sooner than later. I wrote this to them: Super Pumped and realllllly happy that you guys are considering making SSL the DEFAULT for all sites!

item.title: Good I-group tonight
item.description: 21:53 Monday 16 November 2015 JST “What would you change in your work/job if you could change anything?”

item.title: Safely in Perth
item.description: 01:01 Thursday 15 October 2015 JST I’m in Perth! Jennie J’s Perth, in Australia! Thanks to Godfrey for picking me up at the airport and giving me a whole upstairs with shower, loo, and two bedrooms! And TV! There’s a strong wifi signal, but I forgot to ask him for the password. Tomorrow morning we’re going for a walk on the beach!

item.title: Pop Pop Chaos can be played anonymously
item.description: 13:54 Friday 04 September 2015 JST Posted at https://forums.meteor.com/t/new-easy-silly-game-pop-pop-chaos-my-first-mmo/9295 If you have time to click click click some colorful bubbles, check out my new game https://www.poppopchaos.com/ Click bubbles to inflate them; the one who pops the bubble gets the points! Reach the leaderboard by creating bubbles with your hard earned points! Thanks to https://github.com/brettle/meteor-accounts-deluxe, you can play anonymously! Feedback welcome.

item.title: MBP was not wiped
item.description: 13:06 Sunday 12 July 2015 JST They just replaced the magsafe input thing.

item.title: great day at Travis and Yumi's
item.description: 21:30 Sunday 07 June 2015 JST Productive points: got Debian installed and the firmware for the Broadcom wifi card. made a great nametag for Jennie made a great almost business card for amazeaweek.net on the way home, I added beeps(*) to buttons on our unity game Delicious points: Thai food! okashi! ice cream! Fun points: music people laughter shrinky dinks! Next time I hope to remember to bring my 3Doodler so people can play with it, though it’s not as community-centric as the shrinky dinks.

item.title: Fun day at work
item.description: 17:35 Tuesday 12 May 2015 JST Today we had a meeting that we should have held some time ago! It was the first of what I hope will be weekly meetings. なちゃん translated and we got a lot done, including translating some things that I hadn’t had translated before so couldn’t do the work! Hopefully we’ll be aable to chew through the backlog of tickets and they’ll be happy and I’ll feel helpful/productive/happy yay!

item.title: new student
item.description: 21:46 Saturday 25 April 2015 JST Thanks to Mutsumi connection, I may have another student on Mondays!

item.title: count via md5
item.description: ##16:13 Wednesday 11 March 2015 JST## I’ve bribed a couple people (via /r/bittippers) into adding to the MD5 count thing, breathing some new life into the thread!

item.title: sold a design!!
item.description: ##21:35 Wednesday 24 December 2014 JST## Fantastic! Mutsumi’s friend like the pieces I made and paid me 5000 yen for them. Woohoo!
